titleStmt.title: Remarks upon a late disingenuous discourse, writ by one T.D. under the pretence de causa Dei, and of answering Mr. John Howe's letter and postscript of God's prescience, &c., affirming, as the Protestant docrine, that GOd doth by efficacious influence universally move and determine men to all their actions, even to those that are most wicked by a Protestant.
titleStmt.author: Marvell, Andrew, 1621-1678.

titleStmt.title: Remarks upon a late disingenuous discourse, writ by one T.D. under the pretence de causa Dei, and of answering Mr. John Howe's letter and postscript of God's prescience, &c., affirming, as the Protestant docrine, that GOd doth by efficacious influence universally move and determine men to all their actions, even to those that are most wicked by a Protestant.
titleStmt.author: Marvell, Andrew, 1621-1678.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed, and are to be sold by Christopher Hussey ...,

notesStmt.note: Attributed to A. Marvell. Cf. Wing; NUC pre-1956.
Reproduction of original in University of Texas Library.
